archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
name: Raan-Style Leg of Lamb with Saffron Almond Pilaf and Cucumber-Mint Raita
description: Slow-roasted North Indian spiced leg of lamb served with a fragrant saffron-almond basmati pilaf and a cooling cucumber-mint raita. A festive, centerpiece roast with classic sides.
prep_steps: Soak 2 cups basmati rice in cold water for 20 minutes; drain.
Crush 6 cloves garlic to a paste.
Grate or finely chop 1 cucumber; squeeze out excess liquid.
Chop a small handful of mint.
Warm 2 tablespoons water and steep a pinch of saffron for 10 minutes.

Make lamb marinade in a bowl: 1.5 cups yoghurt, juice of 1 lemon, garlic paste, 2 tablespoons garam masala, 2 teaspoons ground cumin, 1 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon black pepper, 1–2 teaspoons chili flakes, 2 teaspoons salt, and 2 tablespoons oil.
Pat dry 1 leg of lamb and score shallow crosshatches on the surface.
Rub marinade all over the leg of lamb, pushing into cuts; cover and refrigerate 2–12 hours.
Preheat oven to 160°C/320°F. Set out a large roasting pan with rack and foil.
cook_steps: Place marinated leg of lamb on a rack in the roasting pan; cover loosely with foil.
Roast at 160°C/320°F for 2 hours, basting with pan juices every 30 minutes.
Remove foil, increase oven to 200°C/390°F, and roast 20–30 minutes more until deeply browned and internal temp reaches about 60–65°C/140–149°F for medium. Rest 20 minutes, tented.
For raita: in a bowl combine 1 cup yoghurt, grated cucumber, chopped mint, 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds (lightly crushed), a squeeze of lemon, and salt to taste. Chill.
For pilaf: heat 2 tablespoons ghee in a wide pot over medium heat. Add 2 bay leaves, 4 cardamom, 4 cloves, and a small piece of cinnamon; sizzle 30 seconds.
Add chopped onions with a pinch of salt; cook 8–10 minutes until golden.
Stir in drained basmati rice; cook 2 minutes to coat in ghee.
Add saffron with its soaking water, 3.5 cups water, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper; bring to a simmer.
Fold in 1 cup peas and 1/2 cup roughly chopped almonds. Cover, reduce to low, and cook 12–15 minutes until rice is tender and liquid absorbed. Rest off heat 10 minutes, then fluff.
Warm naan in the hot oven for 3–5 minutes just before serving.
Slice lamb across the grain. Serve with saffron almond pilaf, cucumber-mint raita, and warm naan.
